263d3bbd836072f772f4a11f14e09054 --> Greg Hayes [A record backlog of over $200 billion]

3382b341958db4b5b389ad2ffc3a7c55 --> [Greg Hayes] Revenue for Q1 2024 was $15 billion, up 7% from Q1 2023.

ec757d97ec46364f9bf32b283f9f9ef4 --> We've gotten off to a strong start to the year, with organic sales up 12%, segment operating profit up 10%, and free cash flow in line with our expectations.

ec757d97ec46364f9bf32b283f9f9ef4 --> The commercial aftermarket was up 11% as we continue to see strong growth in both domestic and international RPKs.

879fd9a4a3c5e82449181509971bed01 --> [provide $886 billion in defense spending, which is up 3%.]

a0747c0cd63b2f67d27adb1870c79fe5 --> [Unspecified] Commercial aftermarket sales were up 14%, driven by a 17% increase in parts and repair, a 16% increase in provisioning, and a 3% decrease in mods and upgrades.

a0747c0cd63b2f67d27adb1870c79fe5 --> [Unspecified] Commercial OE sales for the quarter were up 14% versus the prior year, driven by growth in wide-body, narrow-body and bizjet platforms.

a0747c0cd63b2f67d27adb1870c79fe5 --> [Unspecified] Adjusted operating profit of $1.05 billion was up $145 million, or 16% from the prior year.

8b77072c80e9ab49eb740e496e489951 --> Neil Mitchill [RTX sales of $19.3 billion were up 12% organically versus prior year, and that is on top of 10% growth in the first quarter of last year.]

777319963478d22ff842ecec35608e69 --> Jennifer Reed [sales were $6.7 billion in the quarter, up 9% on both an adjusted and organic basis]

b0a75bf87f3daa5d4f5f5f7f767c8749 --> Raytheon saw 50 basis points of sequential margin improvement and 20 basis points on a year-over-year basis.

b0a75bf87f3daa5d4f5f5f7f767c8749 --> We saw a double-digit increase in material receipts in the first quarter versus prior year, the fourth consecutive quarter of growth.

b0a75bf87f3daa5d4f5f5f7f767c8749 --> Collins saw strong sales growth and 90 basis points of margin expansion on both a sequential and year-over-year basis.

2f136d515c58a23ee0defb801f50c32b --> Sales of $6.7 billion in the quarter were up 6% on both an adjusted and organic basis.

2f136d515c58a23ee0defb801f50c32b --> Adjusted operating profit for the quarter of $630 million was up $46 million versus the prior year.

2f136d515c58a23ee0defb801f50c32b --> Bookings of $8.1 billion resulted in a book-to-bill of 1.23 and a backlog of $53 billion.

163686c055ce249ec98b2ba8c4f64cb1 --> Chris Calio: "With our portfolio strength and current demand, our overall backlog is at a record $202 billion."

ddff5ff762248caf8f1c2810a47836df --> Sales of $6.5 billion were up 23% on both an adjusted and organic basis with sales growth across all three channels.

ddff5ff762248caf8f1c2810a47836df --> Commercial OE sales were up 64% in the quarter and higher engine deliveries and favorable mix in the large commercial engine business.

ddff5ff762248caf8f1c2810a47836df --> Commercial aftermarket sales were up 9% in the quarter, driven by higher volume within large commercial engines, primarily related to GTF overhaul activity, as well as an increased volume at Pratt Canada.

ddff5ff762248caf8f1c2810a47836df --> Legacy large commercial engine aftermarket revenues were down slightly versus prior year as a result of increased allocation of material to support the GTF fleet.

ddff5ff762248caf8f1c2810a47836df --> In the military engine business, sales were up 21%, primarily driven by higher sustainment volume across the F-135, F-117, and F-100 platforms, and higher development volume, primarily driven by the F-135 engine core upgrade program.

0862058d944042b660d8fab8aa7c0ebb --> Neil Mitchill [9% aftermarket growth in the first quarter was largely as we expected.]

0862058d944042b660d8fab8aa7c0ebb --> Neil Mitchill [We're actually down a handful of shop visits year-over-year in the first quarter, a little bit -- around 175 or so.]

c5e7bfa15fda6a7f5747d084a2ce844b --> Neil Mitchill - "Most of that was on the back of commercial OE deliveries, up 40% almost in the first quarter on a unit basis."

307b1ae675952932f03e60dc8869f2c1 --> Sheila Kahyaoglu [15.7% adjustment in the quarter]

0609cca8afee8b054dd3090cf3f49141 --> Neil Mitchill: "in the first quarter we saw about a $58 million year-over-year Q1 to Q1 improvement."

0609cca8afee8b054dd3090cf3f49141 --> Neil Mitchill: "we had the exercise of an option last year, which accounts for maybe, 55% of that improvement."

0609cca8afee8b054dd3090cf3f49141 --> Cai Von Rumohr: "you had a 23% gain at Pratt in the first quarter."

811eb368582149650cd1f5212e275b77 --> [Unnamed] $500 million of positive productivity.

a7dbb2de2fdd203c0fa9519272fb6600 --> Neil Mitchill [In the first quarter, we had net unfavorable productivity of about $28 million. Nearly all of that was associated with these programs.]

a5d338bd490a8b4a78cb3e4905e21886 --> Chris Calio [Yeah, it's in that range that we've provided in that 250, 300.]

eb4b351501415a4e847e7c87bac8356b --> Chris Calio [We've had four consecutive quarters of material receipt growth at Raytheon.]

09b2fd95c7ee5be321e2d0559ba4424d --> Greg Hayes [We achieved $100 billion in revenue last year.]

c72d3a783fe8331d2e4f58d67fd18c77 --> $74.3 billion in adjusted sales for the full-year, up 11% organically; adjusted EPS of $5.06, up 6% year-over-year.

729c5fb6f48f4ed611e86f0369f84da0 --> On a full-year basis, commercial aftermarket was up 23%, commercial OE was up 20%, and defense was up 4%.

1a3376a894b3a0b952fb2c991995bea3 --> Neil Mitchill [Overall segment operating profit for the year was up 18% versus 2022.]

1a3376a894b3a0b952fb2c991995bea3 --> Neil Mitchill [For the fourth quarter, we had adjusted sales of $19.8 billion, up 10% organically versus the prior year.]

d5e0fc8c85dfae5478648f80824aaf52 --> In the fourth quarter, $9.1 billion of booking resulted in a book to bill of 1.33 and an end of the year backlog of $52 billion.

9879a9e70ecd584200a2efb8ebdcf6fd --> Neil Mitchill [On the narrowbody side, demand for new aircraft remains strong, which continues to support both OE and aftermarket growth. Specific to the commercial OE side, with increasing commercial production rates, we expect commercial OE revenue will be up between about 10% and 15% in 2024. Now, with respect to commercial aftermarket, we currently expect sales to be up over 10% in ‘24, and that's on top of the 23% growth we saw in ‘23.]

0d535e34de29ca21e391f92f47797ec1 --> Jennifer Reed, Sales were $7 billion in the quarter, up 12% on both an adjusted and organic basis driven primarily by continued strengths in commercial OE and aftermarket growth.

0d535e34de29ca21e391f92f47797ec1 --> Jennifer Reed, Commercial aftermarket sales were up 23%, driven by a 27% increase in provisioning, a 26% increase in parts and repair, and an increase of 7% in mods and upgrades in the quarter.

0d535e34de29ca21e391f92f47797ec1 --> Jennifer Reed, Commercial OE sales for the quarter were up 17% versus the prior year, driven by continued growth in both narrow body and wide body platforms.

0d535e34de29ca21e391f92f47797ec1 --> Jennifer Reed, Military sales were up 1% primarily due to higher deliveries.

0d535e34de29ca21e391f92f47797ec1 --> Jennifer Reed, Sales of $6.4 billion were up 14% both on an adjusted and organic basis with sales growth across all three channels.

0d535e34de29ca21e391f92f47797ec1 --> Jennifer Reed, Commercial OE sales were up 20% in the quarter, driven by higher engine deliveries and favorable mix in large commercial engine and Pratt Canada businesses.

0d535e34de29ca21e391f92f47797ec1 --> Jennifer Reed, Commercial aftermarket sales were up 18% in the quarter, driven by higher volume in both large commercial engine and Pratt Canada businesses.

0d535e34de29ca21e391f92f47797ec1 --> Jennifer Reed, In the military business, sales were up 4%, primarily driven by higher sustainment volume, which was partially offset by lower material inputs on production programs.
